critique: The executive order appears to be a legal document amending a previous order. It concerns the administration of retirement pay provisions and eligibility determinations. The language is formal and bureaucratic. There is no indication that the president wants the audience to feel any particular emotion. The order is purely administrative in nature, so the initial scores for all emotions should be very low. After further consideration, I still believe that the executive order is unlikely to evoke any strong emotions. The revised scores will remain very low, reflecting the document's neutral and administrative tone.
